title: The sodium moves around on the surface of the water. Bubbles are formed. After the reaction finished, the teacher added Universal Indicator to the solution. The indicator went purple. What do the bubbles show? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well since it can only either be Hydrogen or Oxygen when ur talking about Adding it to water And I know that NaOH is created then that only leaves H so it must be hydrogen in this fun to do exothermic reaction ….but what you could tell me is what the indicator is called that reacts with hydrogen to turn it purple thanks for the question

The balance chemical equation for this reaction is 2Na + 2H2O = 2NaOH + H2 The bubbles indicates H2 gas has been produced. The purple colour of the universal Indicator indicates the presence of an alkaline which is NaOH
